content.description: A relatively long, adventurous route with only about 25 feet of technical climbing. Scramble up about 20' of class 4 to a short, slightly overhanging bulge protected by a bolt. Make a few committing 5.9 moves over the bulge (a fall could result in a sprained or broken ankle) and continue up a 5.7 slab protected by a bolt. Unfortunately there is no anchor at the top of the slab, so continue scrambling up about 50 feet of class 4 boulders (or easy class 5 if you move right above the tree and go up an offwidth crack) to a single-bolt anchor (can be backed up by a cam) near the top of the formation. Walk off a class 3 ridge to the right and down a trail--and don't forget to climb the tiny summit pinnacle with spectacular views.
content.protection: Two bolts. Take along some cams if you wish to protect class 4 sections and back up the single-bolt anchor.
content.location: Gain the talus ridge just above Kola. Cross west on a faint trail, walk around the corner and down a gully until you see a slabby face on the right with two bolts. The Far Side Gallery is just beyond it to the right.

content.description: Climb up to the huge roof, reach out and clip a bolt. Swing over the roof into jugs and finish up the steep face. Short but funtastic.
content.protection: 2 bolts to anchors on ledge. Clip your draws and lower, retrieve them from above.
content.location: Gain the talus ridge just above Kola. Cross west down a faint trail and walk down and to the left around the corner past a boulder to a short crag with a big roof and two routes that were put up in the early '90s but never published.

content.description: Pre clip the first bolt. Steep hard moves pull over the arete/roof onto the face above and anchor bolts on a ledge.
content.protection: Two bolts to anchor on ledge. Clip with your draws and lower off. Its easy to scramble to the top and retrieve them later.
content.location: Gain the talus ridge just above Kola. Cross west down a faint trail and walk down and to the left around the corner past a boulder to a short crag with a big roof and two routes that were put up in the early '90s but never published.

climbs.name: Night of the Crash Test Dummies

content.description: The middle of three routes at the Gallery, climb straight over the roof on big holds and excellent pocketed rock.
content.protection: Three bolts. Shares the final bolt and anchor with Curse of Madame C. Lower off.
content.location: Gain the talus ridge just above Kola. Cross west on a faint trail and walk around the corner past a buttress and a two bolt slab route (name?) to the recently developed "Far Side Gallery" where there are three short but steep bolted routes that share an anchor.

content.description: Scramble up about 20' of class 4 to a short, slightly overhanging bulge with a vertical crack on its right side (about 10' to the right of a bolt). Climb the crack about 20', walk left about 10' and continue up easy class 5 blocks until you reach a belay bolt with nearby cracks for gear near the top of the crag. Alternatively (not recommended), from the top of the crack you can step right and build an anchor in a crack behind the base of a boulder to the right of a tree, and then exit by scrambling class 4 up and right on a pillar above the chaparral to a trail.
content.location: Gain the talus ridge just above Kola. Cross west on a faint trail, walk around the corner and down a gully until you see a slabby face on the right with two bolts. Climb the obvious crack to the right of the bolts.

content.description: The rightmost and steepest of three routes at the Gallery, climb a face to a hueco under the 2.5' horizontal roof and reach for the first bolt. Power through the roof to thin moves then good holds above. Finish left on the same anchor as the other routes. Option: Sling the third bolt and run it out up the exposed hollow tower above [takes thin cams] then step left to the anchor.
content.location: Gain the talus ridge just above Kola. Cross west on a faint trail and walk around the corner past a buttress and a two bolt slab route (name?) to the recently developed "Far Side Gallery" where there are three short but steep bolted routes that share an anchor.

content.description: Grab big huecos and climb the very steep, short arete.
content.protection: Clip three bolts and the anchor.
content.location: Gain the talus ridge just above Kola. Cross west on a faint trail and walk around the corner past a buttress and a two bolt slab route (name?) to the recently developed "Far Side Gallery" where there are three bolted short but steep routes that share an anchor. "Curse of Madame C" climbs the left arete.
